intro: Capraria semiserrata, commonly known as the serrated capraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. Capraria semiserrata is adapted to rocky and coastal environments, showing resilience to harsh conditions.
